column4: hi, can someone help me find the root of a DMA issue?  I have to put in linux ide=nodma to fix the "mounting root filesystem" hang, and then I have to use sudo hdparm -d1 /dev/hda after the boot to re-enable it or my os is extremely slow!  Can someone please help me fix this?  I'm a linux newb-  so PLEASE PLEASE explain in a way I can understand.  I've used xp my whole life.
Oh, I was seeing if someone else would remotely attempt to give tech support.
seen it-  tried it
they have it on DMA but they dont have it on my support problem
if they did...I wouldn't be in here lol!
argument I did
It would seem so, by the sound of the "official ubuntu support channel"
Argument, its a gui based os.  I shouldn't need to know that stuff lol;  and yes, I've heard your schpeel.
have you thought of using hdparm.conf to re-enable the drives dma?
enable the service and you can enable dma for devices at boot
I have been using the hdparm command to enable it (DMA) manually on bootup...was that what you were referring to?
you can set hdparm to start at boot and setup dma on your drives using hdparm.conf you'll find it in /etc. you then set hdparm to start at boot
just type man hdparm.conf in a terminal
pm me mate
this is what you want http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-16360.html
what were you referring to with the 'session' screen?!?
doesnt matter would mean creating a script and the link i sent you is simpler
sounds like a bios issue or maybe the mobo, check for a newer bios
I dont think the RS480 Bios is supported anymore, is it??  I've googled the shit out of it
got a full mobo model name and number
RS480-M Rev: 1
what bios version do you have now? is it lover that 1.2c
